newsitem.title: UK: Saudi cuts Arab Medium/Heavy to Europe in March.
newsitem.headline: Saudi cuts Arab Medium/Heavy to Europe in March.

text.p: Saudia Arabia cut the price of its Arab Medium and Heavy crudes for European customers in March by 10 and 20 cents a barrel respectively, traders said on Tuesday.
It left the price of its Arab Light crude unchanged and raised Berri Extra Light by five cents a barrel, they added.
In March, Arab Medium will be priced at Dated Brent -$3.15 a barrel and Arab Heavy at Dated Brent -$3.80 a barrel, both fob basis Ras Tanura, they said.
Arab Light for European customers will remain at Dated Brent -$1.85 a barrel while Berri Extra Light will rise to Dated Brent -90 cents, also fob Ras Tanura.
Earlier, Saudi Arabia cut most crude oil price formulas for Asian customers by between 10 and 20 cents a barrel in March, raising only Super Light by 20 cents.
